text: Hi there, anyone with experience in calling extension sdk?

We are testing a custom app (a Chromebar extension) to make calls directly from the HubSpot web pages. The Chromebar extension is connected to a contact center software hosted on premise via WebRTC. We would like to test the calls through the app, once the user press the phone icon.
We have manually set the iframe URL for your browser by setting a localStorage value and it works, but when you hit the button it displays a message that says to turn on calling feature.
HubSpot technical support confirmed us that as we are using a custom app for calling, the HubSpot calling feature shouldn't affect your custom app.
Any idea on how to get out of this situation?
Are you passing through your data as form data?
Here's all the required params:
This seems like an issue on your guys server side. probably not store in the refresh token. HubSpot doesn't store these tokens for you, they just generate new ones.

Hi everyone! I am building an application that contains certain features that are limited to Enterprise HubSpot accounts. Ideally, I would like to be able to check their account for some indication of whether or not they have an enterprise account and hide/show certain features on the front-end of my app based on that information. I know there are no APIs that will specifically tell you that someone has an enterprise level account but has anyone found any other APIs that could be used to infer their subscription tier? FYI, I am building a public OAuth app, with a React front end.
'*<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/settings/account-information-api|/account-info/v3/api-usage/daily>*
Different tiers have different api limits
It's hacky but might work
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/usage-details>
But obviously you can use any api to see the number of API requests that are allowed per day. Just use the `X-HubSpot-RateLimit-Daily` header

Hey everyone, I am trying to set up search functionality to search for terms in a hubdb table. The search API has a feature to search through tables and use querys on it but I can seem to get it working properly. This is the test I am doing using the tableId and I get nothing returned (I know the term is used in the content). Any suggestions or help is appreciated.

Yes I considered that but since the Daily limit for both Professional and Enterprise are the same, this really wont help me find only those who have enterprise accounts. Not to mention the wildcard that is the API Add-on
Yeah, forgot they had the same limits
And that addon is definitely a wildcard

Heres a thought... when having people authenticate my app, i have the enterprise level scopes set as "optional scopes". Is there any way for me to tell during this authentication process if the connected account accepted those optional scopes?

I really don't know but you could always just have someone install the app by going to your website which has a form on it the form would include what plan they're on. Then after knowing this you can direct then to a install link (with the correct scopes).
The HubSpot app can even redirect to your form if they click install from the marketplace
ahhh and then I could record their reply to determine which features to show them
good thought!
thanks!
Exactly
This is a workaround I've used in the past

Oooo it looks like there's an API I can use to decode the OAuth token and view the available scopes. Assuming non enterprise accounts don't accepted the optional scopes, I can simply check for these optional scopes and determine that way if they have an enterprise account
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/oauth/tokens>
NICE! checking this out now
I would be very interested to know if this works
I'll be sure to let you know!
testing it now

Hmm.. it seems that regardless of the account I select, all the scopes are being granted and therefore all are being listed. Event those this documentation seems to state that this should not be the case:
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/working-with-oauth>
I'll have to dig some more
That's kinda what I thought it would do, but I was hopeful
There has the be a good way to get the info
I would say try and create a custom object but you can't do through with a OAuth token anymore

Ok so I have a final workaround. I actually do have access to create custom objects due to this <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/custom-objects-schema-pilot|pilot program>. So when the HubSpot account is connected, I try to create a custom object and check the error logs (if any) and if the error is "MISSING_SCOPES", then the app knows if they dont have enterprise. If there is no error, they do have enterprise!
exactly

Is there endpoint/method documentation for the api v3 as there is for the api v1? I am finding it very confusing on figuring out what is available out there. V3 only seems to be text around specific things, not all the available methods. For Example, I can’t find contact reference, e.g. add contact in v3.
Any help on how best to navigate the documentation and ensure I am using the correct versions of things will be greatly appreciated. Thank you.

:sprocket: Hello! I’m a new Developer Advocate here at HubSpot and I have a friendly request for our HubSpot CRM Developers :sprocket:
I’m looking for feedback/input from those of you who have been developing with the CRM for quite some time. I’m curious when you have a new developer and you want to point out 5 key aspects that are crucial when beginning to work with the HubSpot CRM…..w*hat guidance and best practices do you bestow upon them first?* :eyes:

*Please feel free to share your top 5 best practices when developing with the CRM in the thread below* :thread:*:*
(Note: this is research for a guide highlighting what these best practices are and why to share with the broader community)
Hi guys, new here! I am just looking for a current version of this api - <https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/engagements/get-recent-engagements>. I can see it in v1 however not in v3?

Hello partners!!! We are immersed in a challenge for a client. We have created a custom object for the client, which in this case is a product with multiple denominations. The case is that the client wants to have all the associated commercial activities. We have seen that this can be done, but it does NOT get us the reports of the commercial activities by custom object, has anyone encountered this challenge? Apparently HubSpot is limited in this matter and we are looking at the best way to obtain these reports, since it is very important for the client. Do you know any alternative? Anyone get this kind of info? Is there a way to do it with the API? workflow? Thanks in advance and happy Friday
